intro: Limonium leonardi-llorensii, commonly known as the Canary Islands sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tenerife. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, often found in coastal and sandy environments. It is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat, including salt spray and strong winds. Limonium leonardi-llorensii is a rare and endemic species, making it a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
